word_mean: 瘭疽，指头脓炎：指尖掌侧非常疼痛的脓肿，通常发生在致病菌侵入皮内之后，末节指骨密闭腔隙感染的结果。又称whitlow

sentence.Network_en: So I answered up like a felon fighting for his freedom, and I answered pat, because I was telling the truth, which is sometimes a help.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, literally wicked, a wicked person' (oblique case of fel 'evil'), from medieval Latin fello, fellon-, of unknown origin. Compare with felon
Middle English: perhaps a specific use of felon; medieval Latin fello, fellon- had the same sense

entry.def: A felon is a person who is guilty of committing a felony.

means.word_mean: 1. someone who has committed (or been legally convicted of) a crime
2. a purulent infection at the end of a finger or toe in the area surrounding the nail
